sentence.Network_en: The players' behaviour on the field is likely to bring the game into disrepute .
sentence.Network_cn: 球员在赛场上的表现很可能使这场比赛臭名远扬。

sentence.Network_en: The hotel fell into disrepute after the shooting incident.
sentence.Network_cn: 枪击事件发生后,这家旅馆便声誉扫地.

sentence.Network_en: Such people bring our profession into disrepute.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种人令我们这一行业蒙羞。

entry.def: If something is brought into disrepute or falls into disrepute, it loses its good reputation, because it is connected with activities that people do not approve of.

example.ex: Such people bring our profession into disrepute.
example.tran: 这种人令我们这一行业蒙羞。

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being held in low esteem;

sentences.sentence: "your actions will bring discredit to your name"
"because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute"
